title: Is this really "toxic"?
body:
So basically the only things i said in this game which could be considered toxic are "guess ill take all ur jg minions" (which i didn't and its not even toxic) and "get a life loser" after someone was constantly harassing me all game. if that is toxic than the pg-13 rating on league should be lowered cause 13 year olds definitely would not classify this as toxic. The reports are busted someone can duo with another person and double report you and you can report someone but they wont get banned but you will due to the reports no matter if the other person actually was flaming or trolling. Busted AF report system that just bases it on the number of reports rather than the actual content of the game.

Bullshit. I have been reported in games where I played very good, and broke no community rules. But because I complained about my bot and mid lane inting, they reported me, and I got a ban from it. The system is automatic. No one looks at your report. All it takes is people to report you.

> [{quoted}](name=BV 4 Lyfe,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=EgP5Vq33,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-09-23T02:59:59.554+0000)
>
> broke no community rules. 
> ...
> I complained about my bot and mid lane

I'd just like to point out that these two are practically always mutually exclusive. Complaining about individuals, in and of itself, is fairly negative, and often leads to insults. Given your general attitude in all of your posts thus far, the reasonable conclusion is that you explicitly did the wrong thing when complaining about your team mates and that is what resulted in your punishment (not having it be due to some flaw in the system).

Given your general attitude in all of your posts thus far, the reasonable conclusion is that you explicitly did the wrong thing when complaining about your team mates and that is what resulted in your punishment (not having it be due to some flaw in the system).

Wait, so if you have a lane that is inting, a cait who is 0 6 with a support nunu on 1 15, you can't comment on it? I was not abusive, all I said was please report these players for inting. But aparantly that is toxic.

There's a distinct difference between *commenting* on something, and *complaining* about it. I've seen your chat logs, and it's basically all negative, with some insults thrown in for "good measure". Most players wouldn't care to be in a game with someone who has an attitude like that. Quite frankly, I'm not surprised you got punished (though whether the punishment fits the offence depends on your history, which you may want to take up with Support).

Spastic is a trigger word, and so is threatening to troll, in the systems logic you were toxic

Honestly, just work around it, be passive aggressive, the system can't pick up shit, how do you beat an automated system, you work out how to get around it, it works in every game (both punishment systems and AI), and even the IFS is easy to work around once you work out how and what words trigger the instaban

First off, if you believe you were punished in error, you should submit a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) (use the "Account suspensions or restrictions"option) and appeal the punishment with them (keep in mind, chat restrictions are never removed). They will manually review the case and come to a decision as to whether the punishment was in error. Keep in mind, their decision is final.

As for the chat logs you've provided, yes, it is toxic. It's certainly not among the most serious of offences, but there are plenty of players who wouldn't like to be matched with someone who has your attitude. You've exhibited a consistently negative attitude throughout the match, which is never going to help, and doing things like insulting team mates (such as calling them "spastics") and threatening not to help and even actively disrupting team mates (regardless of whether you follow through) is not acceptable behaviour. I would also like to take a moment to say that how well you play is *completely* irrelevant to whether you've broken the rules (the chat logs make it seem like you don't understand that).

As far as whether you deserved the tier of punishment you received, that depends on a few factors, such as what punishment you have received and what punishments you have previously received. If you wish to discuss that here, you'll need to provide more information. For reference, the standard progression for chat-offences is 10-game chat restriction *then* 25-game chat restriction *then* 14-day ban *then* permanent ban (if you haven't been through the standard progression, I'd say you *might* have a case for reduction).
Riot ban can even you for swearing using non-English words. What do you expect. They suck anyway

The banning system does not involve any human involvement. It all depends on if people report you. You could play a perfect game, but if enough people report you the automatic system kicks in and will ban you.
